title: How Active Recovery Speeds Muscle Repair
description: Active recovery enhances blood flow to muscles, delivering nutrients and clearing waste, which supports healing after intense workouts.

sections.title: Benefits of Active Recovery
sections.content: Engaging in light activity post-exercise—like walking or gentle cycling—increases blood circulation, helping remove metabolic waste and delivering nutrients that repair muscles, tendons, and ligaments.

sections.title: Implement It
sections.content: After training, spend 10–15 minutes doing low-intensity movements focusing on different muscle groups than those just worked.

sources.title: UCHealth: Why rest and recovery is essential for athletes
